titleStmt.title: E. P. Cook to James F. Robinson
CWG8753

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency The Governer of Kentucky

you undersigned petitioner would respectfully represent, That At the May Term ^1857^ of the Butler Equity & Criminal Court Judgment was rendered against him for the Sum of Twenty five Dollars upon a charge of Shooting &c

That the petioner is poor & has a wife and Three Small Children dependent on him for Support, That he has been in the Service of the United States until discharged and been in very bad health ever since and that he has no property out of which this debt in Judgment can be made He asks the interposition of Executive Clemency in his behalf
Sworn to before me by E P Cook March 13th 1863
B. L. D Guffy N, J, B, C, C
We the undersigned Citizens of Butler County state that we are acquainted with E P Cook & we believe the foregoing statements are true. And we earnestly recommend him to executive Clemency

W F Seach
Calvin Hunt
Jonathan Butler
Philip Baynes
